text: Douglas Jackson (December 12, 1924 – April 26, 1980) was a Canadian professional ice hockey goaltender for the Chicago Black Hawks of the National Hockey League during the 1947–48 NHL season and played in six games. From 1944 to 1945, Jackson served with the Canadian Army in World War II. ==References== * * Category:1924 births Category:Canadian ice hockey goaltenders Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Ice hockey people from Manitoba Category:Sportspeople from Winnipeg Category:1980 deaths Category:Canadian military personnel of World War II
title: Doug Jackson
